com.facebook.react

Class ReactRootView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.FrameLayout
          • com.facebook.react.ReactRootView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent, ReactRoot, RootView

    public class ReactRootView
extends android.widget.FrameLayout
implements RootView, ReactRoot
    Default root view for catalyst apps. Provides the ability to listen for size changes so that a UI manager can re-layout its elements. It delegates handling touch events for itself and child views and sending those events to JS by using JSTouchDispatcher. This view is overriding ViewGroup.onInterceptTouchEvent(android.view.MotionEvent) method in order to be notified about the events for all of its children and it's also overriding ViewGroup.requestDisallowInterceptTouchEvent(boolean) to make sure that ViewGroup.onInterceptTouchEvent(android.view.MotionEvent) will get events even when some child view start intercepting it. In case when no child view is interested in handling some particular touch event, this view's View.onTouchEvent(android.view.MotionEvent) will still return true in order to be notified about all subsequent touch events related to that gesture (in case when JS code wants to handle that gesture).

      • onChildStartedNativeGesture

        public void onChildStartedNativeGesture(android.view.MotionEvent androidEvent)
        Description copied from interface: RootView
        Called when a child starts a native gesture (e.g. a scroll in a ScrollView). Should be called from the child's onTouchIntercepted implementation.
        Specified by:
        onChildStartedNativeGesture in interface RootView

      • startReactApplication

        public void startReactApplication(ReactInstanceManager reactInstanceManager,
                                  java.lang.String moduleName,
                                  android.os.Bundle initialProperties,
                                  java.lang.String initialUITemplate)
        Schedule rendering of the react component rendered by the JS application from the given JS module (@{param moduleName}) using provided to attach to the JS context of that manager. Extra parameter can be used to pass initial properties for the react component.

      • unmountReactApplication

        public void unmountReactApplication()
        Unmount the react application at this root view, reclaiming any JS memory associated with that application. If startReactApplication(com.facebook.react.ReactInstanceManager, java.lang.String) is called, this method must be called before the ReactRootView is garbage collected (typically in your Activity's onDestroy, or in your Fragment's onDestroyView).
